books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Guy de Maupassant
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Guy de Maupassant, in order of date of composition.

books.title: Allan Quatermain
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: Adventurer Allan Quatermain sets out on a mission to Africa to locate a mysterious tribe of white-skinned people.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: Erewhon Revisited
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A traveler returns to the country of Erewhon to find out what has happened in the twenty years since he last visited.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: Red Harvest
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A hard-boiled detective arrives at a small mining town only to find his client murdered and the inhabitants embroiled in complex webs of corruption.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: The Book of Jade
books.author: David Park Barnitz
books.summary: A collection of decadent poetry by David Park Barnitz.

books.title: Evelina
books.author: Fanny Burney
books.summary: A young woman navigates the absurdities of 18th-century English society, fends off various suitors, and attempts to establish her true parentage.

books.title: The World Set Free
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Facing the devastation of a nuclear world war, humanity unites under a world government.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
